model.database

Class StockHistoryTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.database.DatabaseTable
      • model.database.StockHistoryTable

  • public class StockHistoryTable
extends DatabaseTable
    Contains methods that run SQL queries relevant to the StockHistory Table This is needed to create and return timestamps producing a line graph of the company stock price history used on the company information screen.
    Since:
    30/10/2018
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Paul King - s3449513

    • Method Summary

      Adds a new timestamp to the database contianing the stock value by referencing object

      Adds a new timestamp to the database using the company code and price
      java.util.List<StockTimeStamp> getAll() 
      static StockHistoryTable getInstance()
      Used to get the static object of this class If the value is null it will be instantiated using a private constructor
      java.util.List<StockTimeStamp> getStockHistory(java.lang.String companyCode)
      retrieves all time stamps in the StockHistory table matching a company's unique code This list is used to for drawing a graph of the history on the GUI

                                      throws java.sql.SQLException

      • getStockHistory

        public java.util.List<StockTimeStamp> getStockHistory(java.lang.String companyCode)
                                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        retrieves all time stamps in the StockHistory table matching a company's unique code This list is used to for drawing a graph of the history on the GUI
        Parameters:
        companyCode - takes the company code as string for use in SQL query
        Returns:
        returns a linked list of objects from 'StockTimeStamp' built from the result set
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addTimeStamp

        public void addTimeStamp(Stock stock)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds a new timestamp to the database contianing the stock value by referencing object
        Parameters:
        stock - taks a stock object as an argument to retrieve the code and the price
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addTimeStamp

        public void addTimeStamp(java.lang.String code,
                         double price)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds a new timestamp to the database using the company code and price
        Parameters:
        code - string reference of the company code for use in the sql query
        price - decimal number for the current market price of the stock
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
